data.text: @annezinkmd @CDCgov So the community case rates will still be reported in an accessible way? Being a parent of an under 5, in an area of low vaccination, those numbers have been key in helping us make decisions for our family. Lumping it all together without seeing the components won't be helpful.
@annezinkmd @bhrenton @CDCgov It's not great for any of us with kids under 5
@annezinkmd @CDCgov This is great news. Better late than never. Thanks for sharing.

@1ittleMERSmaid @bhrenton @CDCgov It is for sure not over.  That is not what I or these guidelines are saying, just we have different tools now than in 2020.  Parents, many kids main close contact, can choose to get vaccinated and that does help to protect them / but we have longer to go.

@annezinkmd @bhrenton @CDCgov Many of us don’t have the luxury of living in communities where we can surround our children with vaccinated adults. 44 children have died of Covid in the past 1.5 weeks. This isn’t over.

@1ittleMERSmaid @bhrenton @CDCgov This has been long and hard for parents with kids under 5.  However, as those around them are vaccinated and cases decreases, their risk of getting COVID decreases.  When cases climb, we add layers of protection for them as well, but hoping for more tools soon!

@annezinkmd @CDCgov How about those who developed immune-mediated hepatitis with the Moderna juice?

https://t.co/5ZJmSvs9a6
